intro: Styrax guanayanus var. yutajensis, commonly known as the Yutajé styrax, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Styracaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Its bark and flowers have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical forests.
